articles.name: How to create user accounts in bulk using admin operations
articles.title: How to create user accounts in bulk using admin operations
articles.body:
Heads up

Bulk data uploads to your database should be managed by support professionals or advanced end users.

How To

How do I import a user list or create multiple GlobalTill user accounts at once using admin operations?

Follow these steps

You can enter user data into an Excel spreadsheet and import it into GT to create or edit users in bulk.

To bulk import a user list using admin operations, follow these steps.

Step 1: Prepare the import users upload file

 Use the following information as a guideline to properly formatting your upload file.

  • Use an Excel spreadsheet, only .xlsx format is accepted.
  • Headers must be an exact match, and are case sensitive.
  • Some formatting, like hidden rows, merged cells, and data tables, may cause the import to fail. For more information see the article How to troubleshoot or fix load files.

Example of an import user upload file


*This image is for visualization purposes. Refer to the accepted header list for all accepted header names.

Here are the accepted headers that can be used to create your import user upload file

Remember, these are case sensitive and must be an exact match.

  • username — The username, used to log in.
  • password — The password, used to log in.
  • first_name — First name.
  • last_name — Second name.
  • email — The email address linked to the user account.
  • display_name — The name displayed at the POS, on receipts and on select invoicing.
  • role — The role of the user account, used to determine access and permissions. Accepted values are A, M, or S, for Admin, Manager or Salesperson, respectively.
  • pos_pin_number — The numeric code used to login to the POS with.
  • show_at_pos — TRUE if the user is shown at the POS, FALSE otherwise.
  • can_login_backoffice — TRUE if the user has back office access, FALSE otherwise.

Step 2: Upload the import users upload file

  1. Go to admin operations at the URL we've provided you with and select Import Users.
  2. Select Choose File, and select your user import users upload file, then select Submit.

articles.name: Why isn't the WP All Import sync running as per schedule?
articles.title: Why isn't the WP All Import sync running as per schedule?
articles.body:
Question

The All Import WordPress plugin is only syncing periodically. We have the plugin scheduled to sync every 30 minutes, but it’s not running every 30 minutes. We have the Scheduling Licence Key installed, and there are no errors being displayed. Why isn't the sync running as per the schedule?

Answer

GlobalTill, unfortunately, has no ability to see exactly what could be causing issues with scheduling as this is triggered by WP All Import directly.

We recommend you work with your WooCommerce web developer to transition to classic cron jobs. Instructions are linked here: Scheduling Imports Using Cron Jobs.

You will switch from automatic scheduling to manual scheduling and follow the instructions on the format in the linked article. Then, follow the instructions specific to the web control panel you use, or set it up via classical cron via the command line.

articles.name: How to edit store email address
articles.title: How to edit store email address
articles.body:
How To

How do I enter or edit my store's email address in GlobalTill?

Follow these steps

The store email address is located on the basic information tab in store settings. To update the store email address, follow these steps.

  1. Select Settings > Store Settings.
  2. From the top right corner, select Edit Store.
  3. Scroll to the bottom of the Basic Tab and enter the email address in the Email field. Select Submit.

articles.name: How to email a customer order
articles.title: How to email a customer order
articles.body:
How To

How do I email a customer order or a customer quote?

Follow these steps

To email a customer order or a customer quote, follow these steps.

  1. Select Selling > Customer Orders. 
  2. Select the Blue Arrow next to the customer order number to open it.
  3. Select Email Quote/Invoice.
  4. Enter the email address in the Customer email field. If there is an email saved in the customer profile, it will populate here by default. Select Email Invoice.
  5. You will be returned to the customer order screen where a green flag will confirm the email has been sent.

articles.name: Where is the container deposit referenced in Shopify?
articles.title: Where is the container deposit referenced in Shopify?
articles.body:
Question

Where is the container deposit referenced in Shopify?

Answer

Container deposits are referenced in Shopify under product options. GlobalTill doesn't send the deposit product itself, it sends the Shopify product ID of the deposit product. Shopify Plus customers typically use the shopping cart editor to auto-add deposits. Regular Shopify customers will typically have their developer use a JavaScript solution.

If you are using Shopify Plus, we recommend referencing the following Shopify documentation.

  • Shopify Scripts and the Script Editor
  • ProductOption

articles.name: How to sync promotional sale prices to all stores
articles.title: How to sync promotional sale prices to all stores
articles.body:
How To

How do I push new promotional sale prices or recent changes to an existing promotional sale to all stores in the indicated price zone?

Follow these steps

To sync sale prices to all stores, follow these steps.

  1. Select Products > Promotions > Sale Management. 
  2. Select the promo from the Promotional Sale List by clicking on the promo name.
  3. From the Actions menu in the top right corner, select Sync to All Stores.

articles.name: What is the B.C. data tab
articles.title: What is the B.C. data tab
articles.body:
What is…

What is the B.C. Data Tab and what information can I find here?

This is an additional tab for British Columbia liquor retailers that contains the Government Liquor Stores (GLS) and Electronic Price List (EPL) product information.

GLS Data

GlobalTill updates the GLS information from bcliquorstores.com once per month to provide the GLS retail price, and the type, country, volume, alcohol content, number of (government) stores (that stock the product) and the rating.

In the B.C. market, the number of stores is an important reference point as it can dictate your pricing strategy. If the product is available in all of the government stores, you may choose to be more competitive and price your product closer to the government price. If the product is not in all of the government stores, you have more flexibility to increase your pricing.

EPL Data

The bottom half of the B.C. Data tab summarizes the data from the Electronic Price List. This shows an Effective Date (for price changes), the Wholesale per Unit and the Change (relative to the previous price).

In the example below, we see this product goes all the way back to 2018 when GlobalTill entered the British Columbia market. On April 1, 2018 this product started out with a wholesale price of $8.30, on September 2, 2018 that increased by $0.17 to $8.47, and continued to climb until stabilizing at the current wholesale price of $9.43.

articles.name: Why does a product scan in as a different product at the POS?
articles.title: Why does a product scan in as a different product at the POS?
articles.body:
Question

When I scan a product's barcode at the POS, it brings up a different product. What could be causing this?

Answer

When a product's barcode is scanned and rings in as a different product on the POS, the most common cause is an incorrect barcode is attached to the product in your database.

We recommend logging into the GT Backend and confirming the barcode for the product you are scanning matches what is on the product packaging.

If the product barcode has been recently updated, try reloading the products on your POS. It's possible that the new product data hasn't been synced yet.

More Information

For more information, see the articles How to add or edit a barcode or How to reload products.

articles.name: How to assign a retail pricing rule to a category
articles.title: How to assign a retail pricing rule to a category
articles.body:
How To

How do I assign a retail price rule to all products in a category?

Follow these steps

To assign a retail pricing rule to an entire category of products, follow these steps.

  1. Select Products > Product Management > Category Manager.
  2. Select the category you wish to assign the pricing rule to.
  3. Select the Retail Pricing Rule from the drop-down list.
  4. Select Submit.

More Information

For more information, see the article How to assign a retail pricing rule to a product.

articles.name: How to add a barcode to a template in the visual template editor
articles.title: How to add a barcode to a template in the visual template editor
articles.body:
Heads up

If a barcode is too small, scanners might not be able to decode it. For the best results, allow enough space in your template so your barcode doesn't wrap around to a second line.

How To

How do I add a barcode to a template in the visual template editor?

Follow these steps

There are different ways to add barcodes to a template. Choose which method suits your needs and follow the steps to add a barcode to a template.

Add multiple barcodes assigned to a product

To include all barcodes assigned to a single product, follow these steps.

  1. Select Container from the left menu to add a container component to the template.
  2. Ensure the container is selected, then under properties select Data Field, and then select Barcode.
  3. Select the Barcode component from the left hand menu and drag it inside the container component.
  4. From the properties window, select Insert Data Field.
  5. Select the Barcode data field, then select Insert Data Field.
  6. Optional: Under properties, check Show text to show the corresponding barcode number below the barcode.
  7. Optional: Under properties, check Quiet Zone to add white space that helps prevent the scanner from picking up items on the label that should not be scanned.

Add a single barcode assigned to a product

To add a single barcode to a template, follow these steps.

  1. Select Barcode from the left menu to add a barcode component to the template. 
  2. From the properties window, select Insert Data Field.
  3. From the list, select the Barcode array to open a drop down, then select Barcode, and then select Insert Data Field.
  4. Optional: Under properties, check Show text and Quiet Zone to clean up the barcode.

Add a barcode as a text field only

Follow the instructions above for either single or multiple barcodes, instead replace the Barcode Component with a Text Component.

Add a SKU as a barcode

If you're using the barcodes to scan in an inventory count, or if you have products from local suppliers that don't have a barcode, you can use the product's SKU to create a barcode.

To add the SKU as a barcode, follow these steps.

  1. Select Barcode from the left menu to add a barcode component to the template. 
  2. From the properties window, select Insert Data Field.
  3. Choose the SKU data field and then select Insert Data Field.
  4. Optional: Under properties, check Show text to display the SKU under the barcode and Quiet Zone to clean up the barcode.

Frequently asked questions

  1. What is a 1D barcode?
    This linear barcode, typically used in grocery stores and consumable items, offers a horizontal range of black and white patterns. The variable-width lines and spaces are used to encode numbers or characters from left to right. 1D barcodes hold a limited number of characters, typically 20-25. 1D barcodes depend on database connectivity, after a scanner reads the numbers in the code, it must be linked back to the product or pricing data, or other information.
  2. What is a 2D barcode?
    A 2D barcode uses patterns, shapes, and dots to encrypt information both horizontally and vertically. Today it is typically used as a QR code, PDF417, and Data Matrix. Unlike the 1D barcode, it has the capacity to hold around 2000 characters Because of its capacity, the data it holds can encrypt includes images, website addresses, and other binary data, which means that the codes can work independently of a database. It is important to note that 2D Barcodes, like QR Codes, require a 2D scanner to work.

More Information

For more information, see the article Why is the barcode on my template corrupted?.

articles.name: How to enable force scan all on mobile
articles.title: How to enable force scan all on mobile
articles.body:
How To

How do I turn on the force scan all option on GT Mobile?

Follow these steps

This setting requires users to scan each individual item when picking orders. In other words, to pick three units of the same product, three scans are needed.

When this setting is disabled, you can scan an item one time and use the pin pad to adjust the quantity.

To enable force scan all, follow these steps.

  1. Select the Menu icon.
  2. Select Settings.
  3. Under Orders, enable Force Scan All.

articles.name: What information do I need before I create a label?
articles.title: What information do I need before I create a label?
articles.body:
GlobalTill's Visual Template Editor uses a drag-and-drop interface that makes designing your own templates easy. Before you create a custom label, you'll need to know the paper size and label dimensions.

Before you create a label template, you'll need the following information.

    • The height and width of your label paper.
    • The page margins of your label paper.
    • The distance between each label on the label paper.
    • The height and width of an individual label.

Label paper purchased from an office supply store typically includes the label measurements on the packaging. You'll need this information to create label templates in GT. If you have to measure, centimetres provide the most accurate measurement, but inches are accepted as well.

articles.name: How to restart a print queue
articles.title: How to restart a print queue
articles.body:
How To

How do I restart my print queue?

Follow these steps

Has your printer suddenly stopped printing? Be sure to check your cables and connections to make sure your printer is still properly connected. If you haven't changed your printer recently or changed (or reset) the  POS station, the problem could be your print queue was paused due to a power surge or another connectivity issue.

Each printer has a print queue. When you print an invoice or label, that print job is stored in the queue before it’s sent to the printer and finishes printing.

To restart the print queue, follow these steps:

On Mac OS Device
  1. Select Applications folder > System Preferences.
  2. Select Printer & Scanners.
  3. Select Open Print Queue.
  4. Select the Pause/Resume toggle.

On PC/Windows Device
  1. Select Control Panel > Settings
  2. Select Devices > Printers & Scanners
  3. Click the printer for which you want to view the queue
  4. Click Open Print Queue.



  5. From the menu bar, you can select Printer > Restart or you can right-click a print job to cancel, pause, or restart it.

articles.name: How to edit web product data
articles.title: How to edit web product data
articles.body:
Before you start

The web status product attribute determines what products appear on the web and in select integrations. Web product status must be enabled to access the web data tab, make sure it's enabled before you start.

How To

How do I edit web product data?

Follow these steps

Changes to web data are often made in bulk using the Web Data Import, but knowing how to edit a product's web data in the UI is useful when you need make a change to a single product. To edit web product information on a single product, follow these steps.

  1. Select Products > List and open the product you wish to edit.
  2. On the Web Data tab, select Edit Web Data.
  3. Move through the Basic information,Tags, GT Commerce, and Advanced tabs to update the values.

More Information

For more information, see the articles:

  • How to enable web product status
  • How to enable web product status by default
  • What criteria controls product availability in online purchase channels?

articles.name: If I edit an order in WooCommerce, are the changes updated in the GT Backend?
articles.title: If I edit an order in WooCommerce, are the changes updated in the GT Backend?
articles.body:
Question

If I edit an order in WooCommerce, are the changes updated in the GT Backend?

Answer

Generally speaking, alterations made to an order in WooCommerce after it has been sent to GlobalTill are not reflected in the GT Backend. Remove the additional reference number from the original customer order in GT, delete the original customer order in GT, then re-pull the updated WooCommerce order back into GT.

WooCommerce can be customized to update existing GT orders, eliminating the need to re-pull, using appropriate webhooks. Reach out to your WooCommerce developer for more information.

articles.name: How to add or edit a product barcode
articles.title: How to add or edit a product barcode
articles.body:
How To

How do I attach a barcode or SCC to a product in GlobalTill?

There are two types of codes that typically come with a product.

  • The Barcode or UPC (Universal Product Code), which is located on the product itself (a single bottle of wine, for example). 
  • SCC (Shipping Container Codes), which is located on the container of the product (such as a case of wine).

In GlobalTill you have the ability to assign both codes to a product. This article explains how and why you would do this.

Follow these steps

  1. Select Products > List.
  2. Locate and view the product.
  3. Select the Barcodes tab, and then select Add Barcode.
  4. Add the Barcode by either typing it manually or scanning it.  To scan the barcode,  your scanner must be in Keyboard Wedge mode. You will also need to click or tap within the Barcode text field before scanning the product.
  5. Enter the Quantity that should be recorded when the barcode is scanned. Under normal circumstances, when you add a barcode that number should be 1 unless you want it to scan as a case.
  6. If adding an SCC code be sure to enter the correct Quantity. A case of 12 units, for example,  would have a quantity of 12. 


  7. Select Submit to save the changes.
  8. Edit a Barcode by selecting the existing barcode from the list.
  9. Use the Red X to remove the barcode.

articles.name: How to enter a Coca-Cola invoice
articles.title: How to enter a Coca-Cola invoice
articles.body:
How To

How do I enter a Coca-Cola supplier invoice?

Follow these steps

To enter a Coca-Cola invoice into GlobalTill, follow these steps.

Set up Coca-Cola as a supplier

To set up Coca-Cola as a supplier, follow these steps.

  1. Select Purchasing > Suppliers List.
  2. Select Actions > New Supplier.
  3. Enter the Supplier Name as Coca-Cola Canada, and input the Default tax rate for your region.
  4. Ensure Prices includes taxes and Auto subtract deposit are both unchecked. Then select Submit.

Create the invoice

Once Coca-Cola is setup as a supplier, create and populate the invoice.

To create the invoice, follow these steps.

  1. Selecting Purchasing > Supplier Invoices.
  2. Select the Wrench icon > New Supplier Invoice.
  3. Select Coca-Cola Canada as the supplier, enter the Date of invoice, enter the Supplier reference, then select Submit.
  4. From the blank invoice, select Actions > Edit.
  5. Select New to add products.
  6. In the Coca-Cola example below, enter the unit price as the cost into the GT Backend. Work from the email confirmation from Coca-Cola because their unit price includes GST, but does not include a deposit.

    Coca-Cola Invoice Example

  7. In the GT Backend, the invoice is entered like this.
  8. Once your invoice is complete, post and receive the invoice as usual.

Frequently asked questions

  1. Why is the deposit $2.00? 
    For 2L bottles, GT follows the container deposit rule for Alberta, which is $0.25 on bottles larger than 1L. Eight bottles at $0.25 is $2.00 total.
  2. How do I know the units per case?
    Some versions of the Coca-Cola invoices have the units per case in the product description, like 2x15x355 mL. However, not all versions do. When in doubt, consult with Coca-Cola directly.
  3. The total of the GlobalTill invoice doesn't match my paper invoice. Why?
    Coca-Cola has a non-line item fee called a container recycling fee. This is separate from government-mandated bottle deposits. You are not required to add this charge in GlobalTill, but you may if you want your order total to be closer to the balance.
    • Enter this in GT as an order charge non-line item.  From the supplier invoice, select Actions > Edit, then select Edit Invoice Info from the top of the screen.
    • Enter the recycling fee in the Order charge non line item field, select yes under Order charge non line item taxable, then select Submit.

articles.name: How to switch between stores with a multi store user account
articles.title: How to switch between stores with a multi store user account
articles.body:
Heads up

If a new location has been added to your multi store user account, you must log out of GlobalTill completely and log back in for the new location to appear in the drop down.

How To

How do I switch between stores using a multi store user account?

Follow these steps

If your account is provisioned to access multiple stores, follow these steps to switch between stores. Reach out to your organization's internal IT department for questions related to your user account.

  1. Login to your main GlobalTill account.
  2. You will see an additional icon beside the logout button located in the top right corner of the screen. Select this icon.

      Heads up

    Not every multi store location has multi store user accounts. Speak to your internal IT department, or reach out to your support contact if you are unsure.

  3. Select the store from the dropdown menu and press Go.

articles.name: How to convert a customer quote to a customer order
articles.title: How to convert a customer quote to a customer order
articles.body:
Heads up

This article explains how to convert an existing quote to a customer order. If you need to create the quote first, see the article How to create a customer quote.

How To

How do I convert a customer quote to a customer order?

Follow these steps

  1. Select Selling > Customer Orders.
  2. Locate the quote you wish to convert. Quotes have a “Q “in front of the order number.
  3. Click the Blue Arrow beside the order number to open it.
  4. Select Convert to Order and follow the prompts.
  5. The quote will be converted to a customer order.

More Information

For more information, see the article How to process a customer order.

articles.name: How to turn on auto print
articles.title: How to turn on auto print
articles.body:
How To

How do I turn on auto print?

Follow these steps

Auto Print triggers the print dialog box without user inputs. If this is disabled, the user must manually press the print button to print a receipt.

  1. Select POS Settings > Printing.
  2. Turn on Auto Print.

articles.name: How to enable stay on print screen
articles.title: How to enable stay on print screen
articles.body:
How To

How do I enable stay on the print screen?

Follow these steps

The stay on print screen setting keeps receipts on your screen until Done is selected or another product is scanned to start a new transaction.

To enable stay on print screen, follow these steps.

  1. Access the POS Settings.
  2. Select the Printing tab.
  3. Enable Stay on Print Screen.

articles.name: How to use the product list at the POS
articles.title: How to use the product list at the POS
articles.body:
How To

How do I use the product list at the POS?

Follow these steps

To understand how to navigate the product list at the POS, follow these steps.

  1. Access the Product List by selecting the List icon on the right hand side bar of the POS.
  2. Use the SKU, Name, Category, and Price fields to search or filter the Product List.
  3. Enable Only show available items to hide out of stock or unavailable products.
  4. Customize the number of products reflected on each page of the list.

  5. Select the Add button beside a product in the list to add a product to a transaction.
  6. Click the square icon next to each product to review the Inventory Details.

    Inventory details include Available, Coming for Stock, Storage Location, Pending Return and Dedicated to Customer.

  7. Reload Products will sync any recent product changes made in the GT Backend to the POS immediately.

articles.name: How to delete unused product sizes
articles.title: How to delete unused product sizes
articles.body:
How To

How do I delete unused product sizes?

Follow these steps

  1. Select Products > Product Management > Size Manager.
  2. Select the Wrench icon Delete Unused Product Size.
  3. Confirm the list of sizes and select Delete. This cannot be undone.

articles.name: How to create a coupon discount
articles.title: How to create a coupon discount
articles.body:
Before you start

If using barcodes to scan coupons at the POS, enter the coupon prefix in your store settings before getting started. 

How to

How do I create an in-store coupon for use at the POS?

Follow these steps

Coupons are used in retail across various industries and regions to encourage new business and drive traffic into a store.

To create an in-store coupon, follow these steps.

  1. Select Product > Promotions > Coupons.
  2. Select Actions > New Coupon.
  3. Enter the coupon details and select Submit. A breakdown of the field definitions is provided below.
    Field Definition
    Name The name of the coupon.
    Active Turns the coupon on or off. When inactive, the coupon remains in the Coupon Listing in the GT Backend, but is removed from the View Coupons at the POS.
    Type Type of discount, can be dollar discount or percentage off.
    Valid until

    The date the coupon expires. For example, if I enter March 24 in this field, the coupon is valid until March 23 at 11:00 PM.
    Amount

    The dollar amount or percentage off of the coupon. Enter 5 for $5 or 5%.
    Only valid for categories

    Use to restrict coupon to products in categories selected here. If not discounting by category, leave blank.
    Only valid for subcategories

    Use to restrict coupon to products in subcategories selected here. If not discounting by subcategory, leave blank.
    Only valid for Use to restrict coupon to products in this list. If not restricting to a specific product or products, leave blank.
    Minimum spend The minimum purchase amount for the coupon to apply.
    Coupon barcode A unique barcode to identify the coupon. Create a number or scan the barcode of your coupon and enter it here. Include the coupon prefix in this field. For example, if I entered the coupon prefix "C9" in my store settings, include C9 in the number entered here.
    Customer account only Enable to restrict coupon use to purchases made under customer profiles only (dicount won't apply to walk-in customers).
    Allow manual use at POS Enable to add the coupon to View Coupons at the POS to allow cashiers to manually apply the discount without requiring the physical coupon.

    In this example, when a customer buys Widget G, they'll get 50% off if the coupon is applied.
  4. Redownload store data at the POS to sync the coupon to the POS immediately.

Best Practices for barcoding in-store coupons

Use these tips to prevent conflicts between coupon barcodes and product barcodes. We recommend using an online barcode generator and printing a sheet of paper with scannable coupon barcodes to keep beside the POS for each promo period.

  • Avoid using standard UPC codes as coupon barcodes, we've seen this create scanning issues.
  • Pick a common coupon prefix for all coupon barcodes, for example 4000 or C9.
  • Remember to enter the coupon prefix in your store settings. For detailed instructions, see the article How to enter a coupon prefix in store settings.
  • Create a systematic way of generating barcodes for coupon use. This will prevent duplicate barcodes and make generation faster and easier. For example 40001, 40002, etc., or go by date, 400003092021 for March 9, 2021.
  • If your barcode doesn't apply the discount when scanned, try opening the notepad app on your computer and scanning the barcode into the notepad. Verify the numbers scanned into the notepad match what is intended for the barcode.

More Information

For more information, see the article How to apply a coupon to a transaction at the POS and How to enable manual coupon activation at the POS.

articles.name: Can I re-pull an updated order into GT if it's already in the customer orders list?
articles.title: Can I re-pull an updated order into GT if it's already in the customer orders list?
articles.body:
Question

I've made changes to an order on the WooCommerce side after it was already pulled into the GT customer orders list. Can I re-import the updated order?

Answer

Yes. You can re-pull an updated order into GlobalTill by removing the additional reference field from the original order that will no longer be used.

Open the customer order and select Actions > Remove Addl Reference.

You may now manually re-pull the updated order back into GlobalTill by selecting Actions > Pull Order from WooCommerce from the customer order list. See this article for detailed steps, What should I do if a specific WooCommerce order is not coming through to the GT Backend?.

  Heads up

As a best practice, we recommend deleting the original customer order (Actions > Delete Entire Order) before re-pulling in the adjusted order. This will keep your environment cleaner.

articles.name: How to use the RMA button to process a return to vendor
articles.title: How to use the RMA button to process a return to vendor
articles.body:
Heads up

The RMA button is a custom feature pending release to the general client base. Reach out to your GlobalTill account contact if you would like to request early access.

How To

How do I process a Return Merchandise Authorization (RMA) using the RMA button?

Follow these steps

The Process RMA button acts as a shortcut to create a reverse supplier invoice used to record the return of goods to a supplier. For more information how the Process RMA button records the transaction, see the article How to process a return on a supplier invoice.

To process a Return Merchandise Authorization (RMA) using the RMA button, follow these steps.

  1. Locate the product in GlobalTill and open it.
  2. Select the Inventory tab.
  3. Select the Process RMA button.
  4. Enter the RMA details. Below I am returning one unit from my main inventory location, and including the RMA number and a note with further information on the RMA. Select Submit.

      Heads up

    If your organization uses internal inventory locations such as Unsellable to hold returns until month end, remember to change the Inventory Location in the dropdown from Main to Unsellable.

  5. The RMA is complete will be reflected under Recent Transactions on the Inventory tab. Details of the RMA are listed in the table below.
    Type
    The inventory transaction type: purchased from vendor. This will appear in most regulatory reports under the header: Returns to Vendor.
    Change
    Quantity of units removed from the RMA. This will be negative.
    Location
    The internal inventory location where the units were removed from.
    Cost
    The cost average of the product. If the cost average is not populated, GT will reference the unit cost.
    Notes
    The RMA Reference number entered.

Frequently asked questions

  1. What inventory locations can be selected?
    You can process an RMA from any location. Inventory will be removed from the location selected.
  2. How many units can be entered?
    The RMA button accepts quantities between 1 and 999 units. There must be sufficient inventory available in the selected inventory location or an error message will prevent you from processing.
  3. What does the error message "Product must have a default supplier set to use RMA" mean?
    This means the product doesn't have an assigned default supplier. Select Actions > Edit product, then go to the Ordering tab to assign one. If your data is centrally managed, reach out to your organization's Data Management team to request they update the product in the main environment.
  4. Where do the notes entered in the RMA go?
    The notes entered in the RMA form are attached to the supplier invoice that gets created under Purchasing > Supplier Invoices. (The RMA number entered in the RMA form is placed under the Notes field on the inventory transaction tab).

More Information

For more information, see the article How to process a return on a supplier invoice.

articles.name: How to re-download a previously generated report
articles.title: How to re-download a previously generated report
articles.body:
Heads up

This article applies to the GlobalTill Beta reporting module only.

How To

How do I re-download a copy of a previously generated report?

Follow these steps

Every report you generate in GT reporting is saved in the Report Archive. To re-download a copy of a previously run report, follow these steps.

  1. Select Reporting > Report Archive.
  2. Select Columns to add the Download column to visibility. You may wish to add additional columns to help locate the report you wish to re-download.
  3. Locate the report you wish to re-download and select the icon under the Download column.

articles.name: How to email an invoice
articles.title: How to email an invoice
articles.body:
Before you start

Invoices must be posted to be emailed. To post an invoice, select Actions > Save.

How To

How do I email an invoice from the GT Backend?

Follow these steps

  1. Select Selling > Invoices.
  2. Locate the invoice and select View.
  3. Select Actions > Email PDF or Actions > Email CSV.
  4. Enter the customer email address and select the invoice template from the dropdown. Select Email Invoice.
  5. You will be returned to the invoice screen where a green flag will confirm the email has been sent.

articles.name: How to edit order info on a customer order
articles.title: How to edit order info on a customer order
articles.body:
How To

How do I edit or update the order information on an existing customer order?

Follow these steps

GlobalTill allows changes to customer order details after the order is created. For example, a stock out from my supplier has prevented me from fulfilling a line item on an order that is otherwise ready for fulfillment. I might choose to update the order details to add a note confirming that I reached out to the customer to advise them of the wait time or offer a refund/credit.

To update an existing customer order, follow these steps.

  1. Open the order you wish to update.
  2. Select Update Order Info.
  3. Enter order updates and select Submit. In this example, I'm adding a note to advise that the customer is okay with partial delayed shipment.
  4. You will be returned to the Customer Order Screen.

articles.name: Why aren't all products in a sale highlighted in green?
articles.title: Why aren't all products in a sale highlighted in green?
articles.body:
Question

Why aren't all products in a sale highlighted in green to indicate the sale price is active?

Answer

If a product is in more than one active sale, GlobalTill will select the lowest sale price from all active sales. If your sale is in Status: Active, but there are products that are not highlighted in green, it is likely that the unhighlighted products are active in another sale with a lower sale price.

articles.name: Why are there items in status dedicated to customers?
articles.title: Why are there items in status dedicated to customers?
articles.body:
Question

Why is there inventory reflected under Dedicated to Customers on a product's inventory tab?

Answer

When an order is parked at the POS, or is in pre-Invoiced status in the Customer Order List in the GT Backend, the inventory status for each product on the order changes from Available for Sale to Dedicated to Customers. When the transaction is completed, and the customer order status is changed to Invoiced, the inventory is cleared from Dedicated to Customers and deducted from the main inventory location.

If there are units in inventory status Dedicated for Customers it usually means there is an open customer order (or orders) that contains this product that has not been finalized.

Click on the number beside Dedicated to Customers (under Quantity) to see a list of open orders containing this product. Select Go To Order to be taken to the order and finalize or cancel the order to clear inventory from Dedicated to Customers.

Remember to finalize click and collect or eCommerce transactions on the POS by selecting Complete Payment on POS.

More Information

For more information, see the articles How to use the customer order list and What does each customer order status mean.

articles.name: Do I have to wait for an overnight sync to see a new product in Shopify?
articles.title: Do I have to wait for an overnight sync to see a new product in Shopify?
articles.body:
Question

I added a new web product to my GlobalTill store. Do I have to wait for the overnight sync to see it in Shopify?

Answer

No. To sync a new web product to Shopify immediately, go to the Web Data tab, select Shopify Sync - Full Update. Otherwise, the product will not be in Shopify until the following day, after the scheduled data sync.

More Information

For more information, see the article Can I sync all product and inventory data to Shopify without waiting for regular syncing?

articles.name: Why is the checkout button greyed out when trying to process a parked order?
articles.title: Why is the checkout button greyed out when trying to process a parked order?
articles.body:
Question

Why is the Checkout button on the POS greyed out when trying to process a parked transaction?

Answer

If the Checkout button is greyed out on the POS when processing a parked order, but turns green after you have entered or scanned the unit quantities for each line item, it is likely that the Scan Out Invoice setting is enabled on the POS station.

Scan Out Invoice is an option that tells GlobalTill to keep the checkout button disabled on the POS until all items are scanned. This is used as an operational control to verify the products in the actual transaction match what is in the parked order. 

To access the Checkout button when Scan Out Invoice is enabled, simply select Product Check from the POS buttons, then scan each physical product so GlobalTill can confirm the physical goods being sold match what was entered on the parked order.

More Information

For more information, see the articles How to process a parked order at the POS when scan out invoice is enabled and How to enable scan out invoice.

articles.name: What are the retail pricing rule options specific to British Columbia liquor stores
articles.title: What are the retail pricing rule options specific to British Columbia liquor stores
articles.body:
Heads up

This article is designed to provide additional information on the use of retail pricing rules for British Columbia liquor retailers. For general information on how retail pricing rules work in GlobalTill, see the articles What is a retail pricing rule and How to create a retail pricing rule. 

What is…

What are the retail pricing rule options specific to British Columbia liquor stores?

Retail pricing rule options specific to British Columbia liquor stores and their use case include:

Option Use Case
Price based on*: Highest of last ordered cost, cost average and BC LDB cost (base) This BC LDB cost is the current cost of the product in the EPL. If you purchase an item from the LDB on sale and have this option selected, it might get priced based off the discounted sale price.
Price based on*: Highest of last ordered cost, cost average and MAX BC LDB cost (base)

The MAX BC LDB cost is the highest LDB cost for the last six months. This is often used when you want to price to the regular LDB cost and skip over any limited time sale prices.

Many retailers like this option because it prevents them from unintentionally setting their prices lower when they purchase a product at a temporarily lower price.

The downside to this rule is that legitimate price drops may not trigger a price decrease in GlobalTill for a period of 6 months, so it is important to maintain other means of awareness when suppliers decrease prices.
Checkbox: Match BC Liquor Stores  When this is checked off GlobalTill will match the price to the Government Liquor Store price (provided the product has a GLS price and the GLS price has been updated in the last 30 days).

articles.name: How to print labels made in visual template editor
articles.title: How to print labels made in visual template editor
articles.body:
Heads up

Visual editor does not yet accept the following printing fields: Price book, Make barcode available, Include web data, start at label.

How To

How do I print shelf labels made in the visual editor from the product list?

Follow these steps

  1. Select Products > List.
  2. Select the products you wish to include in your labels by clicking on the row of the product. Selected product rows will be highlighted in blue.

  3. Select the Print Labels > Special Print.
  4. Choose the Template you wish to use.

  5. Select Submit.
  6. The labels will be generated (depending on the quantity of labels you are printing this can take a few seconds or a few minutes). When it is finished you will see a link you can click to download a printable PDF.

More Information

For more information, see the article How to sort print order in visual editor.

articles.name: How to enter or edit equivalent grams
articles.title: How to enter or edit equivalent grams
articles.body:
How To

How do I enter or edit a product's equivalent grams?

Follow these steps

To enter or edit equivalent grams, follow these steps:

  1. Select Products > List.
  2. Locate the product and open it.
  3. Select Actions > Edit Product.
  4. Select the Other tab.
  5. Enter the value in the Equivalent g field.

articles.name: Why is my purchase order not closing after converting it to an invoice?
articles.title: Why is my purchase order not closing after converting it to an invoice?
articles.body:
Question

Why isn't my purchase order closing after I convert it to a supplier invoice?

Answer

Auto-close PO on conversion is a setting that must be enabled on an individual supplier.  To turn this setting on in the GT Backend, you should:

  • Select Purchasing > Supplier List.
  • Locate the Supplier and open it.
  • Check Auto Close on Po Conversion.

articles.name: How to clear previously ignored retail price changes
articles.title: How to clear previously ignored retail price changes
articles.body:
How To

How do I clear previously ignored retail pricing changes?

Follow these steps

Clear All Ignored clears all suggested price changes that have been previously ignored and places them in the pending queue. Once in the pending queue, they can be reviewed, applied, discarded, or ignored again.

To use Clear All Ignored to clear the suggested retail price changes you've previously ignored, follow these steps. 

  1. Select Products > Pricing > Retail Prices.
  2. Select Actions > Pending Retail Price Changes.
  3. Select Clear All Ignored.
  4. Remember to check for new retail price changes after clearing the list of previously ignored changes. 

More Information

For more information, see the article How to check for retail price changes and How to ignore retail pricing changes.

articles.name: What is the difference between the BDL invoice and order confirmation?
articles.title: What is the difference between the BDL invoice and order confirmation?
articles.body:
What is…

What is the difference between the BDL invoice and the order confirmation I receive in my email?  Which should I use to import my order into GlobalTIll?

Prior to November 2020, you would receive a confirmation from order.bdl.ca after placing an order.  Then, you would receive the invoice as a physical paper copy upon delivery. Now with the website beerforbusiness.ca, you receive electronic copies of both the confirmation and invoice in your email. 

How can you identify the invoice from the confirmation?

Invoice

  • Underneath the BDL logo, you see Invoice.
  • The file name starts with "Beer Bill."
  • The file contains an invoice number.
  • Columns include "Quantity Confirmed" and "Quantity Shipped."

Confirmation

  • Underneath the BDL logo, you see "Order Confirmation."
  • The file name starts with a 4 digit number and "Beer Order Confirmation."
  • It contains an order number, but no invoice number.
  • Columns include "Quantity Ordered" and "Quantity Confirmed."

What copy should you import?

  • If you place more than one order from BDL per week using GlobalTill's PO generation tools, importing the confirmation may be an important part of your workflow so that the products show up as part of "Coming for Stock."
  • If you only place one order per week, or do not use the automated PO generation tools, then we recommend importing the invoice, rather than the confirmation.

Why does selecting the appropriate copy matter?

  • The confirmation contains a column called 'Quantity Confirmed', which, most of the time, is what you will receive and be invoiced for.
  • Occasionally, you will be short-shipped. The BDL invoice and the 'Quantity Shipped' column represents what your store ultimately received, and can occasionally be more accurate than the numbers in the confirmation.
  • If you import the order confirmation and are subsequently short-shipped, you must manually edit the supplier invoice to update the quantities before posting your supplier invoice, otherwise, your inventory will not be accurate.

What information is imported into GlobalTill?

Order Confirmation

  • Quantity Confirmed @ Unit Price C$

Invoice

  • Quantity Shipped @ Unit Price C$

Common to both Order Confirmation and Invoice:

  • Fuel Charge (Weight)
  • Credits Applied

articles.name: How to set up a default register float
articles.title: How to set up a default register float
articles.body:
How To

How do I set up the cash register float?

Follow these steps

To assign a default register float, follow these steps.

  1. Go to Settings > Store Settings.
  2. Select Edit Store.
  3. Go to the Register Settings tab.
  4. Enter or change the Default Register Float field.
  5. Redownload Store Data at the POS to see the change immediately.

articles.name: How to review products without a barcode
articles.title: How to review products without a barcode
articles.body:
How To

How do I review which products in my store are a missing barcode?

Follow these steps

To determine what products in your store do not have a barcode recorded in their product data, follow these steps.

  1. Go to Reporting > Products.
  2. Select Missing Barcodes or Missing Barcodes (in stock) to show which products do not have a barcode on file and do have inventory greater than zero.
  3. Additionally, the Store Overview report, which is emailed every morning and located in Reporting > Archived Reports, contains a list of all products missing barcodes on the Product Warnings tab.

More Information

See the support article How to add or edit a barcode for additional information.

articles.name: How to create a shelf location
articles.title: How to create a shelf location
articles.body:
How To

How do I create a shelf location? How to assign shelf locations to products?

Follow these steps

Create a shelf location

To create a shelf location, follow these steps.

    1. Select Products > Product Management > Location Manager.
    2. Select the Wrench icon and choose New Location.
    3. Enter the Name of the shelf location you wish to create and select Submit.

Assign a shelf location to a product

    There are multiple ways to assign a shelf location to a product. Select the option right for you and follow these steps.
  • To assign shelf locations to individual products, go to the product page and select Actions > Edit product. Select the Other tab and enter the location in Product Shelf Location and Product Shelf Location Two.
  • To assign shelf locations to products in bulk using the admin ops upload, use the headers sku, shelf and shelf2. See the article How to create products in bulk using admin operations.
  • To assign shelf locations to products selected from the product list, use Bulk Set Attributes. See the article How to use bulk set attributes. Heads up, some enterprise locations have Bulk Set Attributes disabled.

Frequently asked questions

  1. The drop down menus are empty when I try to assign a location to a single product using the Other tab. Why?
    Shelf locations must be created before they can be assigned to products. Follow the steps in Create a Shelf Location to create locations before assigning them to products.
  2. I get an error message when I select Actions > Edit Product on the product page. Why?
    Many enterprise customers manage product data from a centralized Primary environment. Some enterprises block modification of product data outside of the Primary environment. If you get an error message, reach out to your organization's data management team for access to the Primary environment.
  3. I don't see an option to select Bulk Set Attributes from the product list. Why?
    Bulk Set Attributes is a great tool used to make changes to a large group of products in just a few clicks. To prevent unintentional bulk changes to product data, some enterprise level customers choose to disable Bulk Set Attributes. If you don't see the button in your product list, it's likely your organization has disabled this feature.
  4. Is there a faster way to create Shelf Locations?
    Yes. Assigning shelf locations in bulk using the admin ops upload doesn't require shelf locations to be created first. Values under the headers 'shelf' or 'shelf2' are created as shelf locations upon import and assigned to the SKU listed in the upload file.

articles.name: How to generate a customer profile statement
articles.title: How to generate a customer profile statement
articles.body:
How To

How do I generate a statement of outstanding balances or an activity statement on a customer profile?

Follow these steps

To generate a customer activity statement for a specific date range, or a statement of outstanding balances on a customer profile as at a specific date, follow these steps.

  1. Select Customer > List.
  2. Select View Customer.
  3. Select Actions and choose the type of statement.
  4. Select the statement template and enter the As at date or the Start and End dates (depending on your statement selection). Select Submit.

articles.name: How to enter a non-Iine item charge on a supplier invoice
articles.title: How to enter a non-Iine item charge on a supplier invoice
articles.body:
How To

How do I enter a non-Iine item charge or fuel charge on a supplier invoice?

Follow these steps

  1. Select Purchasing > Supplier Invoice.
  2. Select the invoice which requires the non-line item charge.
  3. Select Actions > Edit.

articles.name: How to copy products from one location to another
articles.title: How to copy products from one location to another

How To

How do I copy products from one location to another?

Follow these steps

  1. Select Multi-Store > Copy > Copy Product.
  2. Select the Copy To Store.
  3. Select the Product To Copy. Select Submit.

More Information

For more information, see the article How to copy barcodes from one location to another.

articles.name: How to enable auto-printing of a voided transaction
articles.title: How to enable auto-printing of a voided transaction
articles.body:
How To

How do I configure the POS to print a receipt when a transaction is voided?

Follow these steps

As confirmation that a transaction has been voided, this setting prints a receipt with SALE VOIDED - DO NOT PAY on it.

To print a receipt when a transaction is voided, follow these steps.

  1. Access the POS Settings.
  2. Select the Printing tab.
